metadata.description: Domain-aware personas with card-specific copy, goals, and milestones. Total: 25 personas (20 tech + 5 non-tech).

swe_product_junior.label: Product SWE - Junior (0-2 years)
swe_product_junior.description: You're in product companies with solid fundamentals. Your path is accelerated compared to service engineers.

target.copy: You're already in a product company with strong engineering culture. Focus on mastering your target role and you'll stand out quickly.
target.goal: Become an expert in your target specialization and land your next role within your company or at another top product company.
action_items: Practice coding problems daily (focus on your role's specialization)
Build 1-2 significant projects that showcase depth in your target area
Participate in design discussions to understand system-level thinking
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: If you want an easier entry point while still working on your target role, service companies have a lower interview bar but different engineering practices. Great for building fundamentals before going back to product companies.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role at a company with lower interview difficulty as a stepping stone.
action_items: Focus on coding fundamentals (less emphasis on advanced system design)
Prepare for interviews with less complex system design questions
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Consider exploring a complementary specialization within your domain. If you're a backend engineer, full-stack could open more doors. If you're frontend, adding backend skills makes you invaluable.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Expand your expertise into an adjacent role, increasing your market value and career optionality.
action_items: Learn the fundamentals of the adjacent specialization
Build a project combining both specializations
Understand how both specializations work together in production systems
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_product_mid1.label: Product SWE - Mid (2-3 years)
swe_product_mid1.description: You're mid-level in a product company. Your path to senior or adjacent roles is well-defined.

target.copy: You have solid experience in product companies. Now it's time to deepen expertise in your target specialization or move to a more prestigious company. Your product background gives you an edge.
target.goal: Achieve your target role at a top-tier company or become a specialist in your current domain.
action_items: Master advanced system design concepts relevant to your role
Lead architectural decisions on your team
Build 1-2 portfolio projects demonstrating advanced competence
Prepare for behavioral interviews at FAANG companies
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Want a quick win? Service companies value mid-level engineers and will fast-track you. It's a great leverage point to move to FAANG later.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role quickly at a service company to gain seniority, then transition to FAANG.
action_items: Focus on system design at medium scale (not massive scale)
Refresh coding skills with 20-30 focused problems
Prepare for service company interview style
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Broaden your skill set by exploring a complementary role. Many successful senior engineers are full-stack or have expertise in multiple areas.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become a versatile engineer with expertise in multiple specializations.
action_items: Deep dive into the adjacent specialization
Build a project showcasing both specializations
Study how top companies combine these roles
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_product_mid2.label: Product SWE - Mid (3-5 years)
swe_product_mid2.description: You're solid mid-level with real product experience. Your path to senior is clear.

target.copy: With 3-5 years in product companies, you understand how real systems work. Focus on system design mastery and you'll be ready for senior roles anywhere.
target.goal: Transition to a senior engineer role, either at your current company or at a top-tier tech company.
action_items: Master large-scale system design (design 10+ complex systems)
Own and ship a major project end-to-end
Build a strong online presence (GitHub, blog, or speaking)
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Consider service companies or startups for your target role. You'll likely get senior or lead opportunities faster than at FAANG, then move to FAANG from a position of strength.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role (possibly at higher seniority) at a service company or startup.
action_items: System design at realistic scale (not massive)
Leverage your 3-5 years of experience as an advantage
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Explore a different specialization. With your 3-5 years of product experience, you have the foundation to transition smoothly.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Master a new specialization while leveraging your existing product engineering knowledge.
action_items: Learn the new specialization (books, courses, projects)
Build 1-2 projects in the new specialization
Study how the new specialization fits into product ecosystems
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_product_senior.label: Product SWE - Senior (5-8 years)
swe_product_senior.description: You're senior-level. Your focus should be on FAANG transition or staff engineer path.

target.copy: As a senior engineer with product experience, you're in high demand. FAANG companies actively recruit at your level. Focus on interview prep and you'll land your target role.
target.goal: Transition to your target role at a top-tier company or become a staff engineer at your current company.
action_items: Perfect your system design (at FAANG-level complexity)
Leverage your experience: you know how real products work
Network actively in the tech community
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies will likely fast-track you to a higher title (Staff/Principal) with less competition. It's a strategic move for career growth.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get a staff or principal-level role at a service company or startup.
action_items: Emphasize your leadership and system design skills
Discuss your vision for technical direction
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: With your 5+ years of product experience, you can move to adjacent specializations from a position of strength. This broadens your impact.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to a complementary specialization while maintaining or increasing seniority.
action_items: Deep dive into the new specialization
Apply your existing expertise to the new domain
Position yourself as a bridge between specializations
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_product_expert.label: Product SWE - Expert (8+ years)
swe_product_expert.description: You're at the top. Focus on your specific career goal: FAANG, founder, CTO, or staff engineer path.

target.copy: With 8+ years of experience, you're in the top 1% of engineers. Your target should be a specific company or role that excites you. FAANG companies or high-impact startups are looking for engineers at your level.
target.goal: Land your ideal role that matches your long-term career vision.
action_items: Identify your specific career goal: FAANG, startup, founder, CTO?
Network strategically at your target companies
Showcase leadership impact, not just coding skills
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: With your expertise, you can join any company and make immediate impact. Service companies or high-growth startups offer more equity and leadership opportunities.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get an executive or founder-track role at a high-growth startup.
action_items: Connect with startup founders and investors
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Consider transitioning to leadership (Staff Engineer, Principal, CTO) or a different specialization. Your 8+ years gives you unique perspective.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to a leadership or specialized role with broader organizational impact.
action_items: Study organizational dynamics and technical strategy
Network with other leaders in your target specialization
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_service_junior.label: Service SWE - Junior (0-2 years)
swe_service_junior.description: You're in service companies (Java/.NET). Your path is longer than product engineers but service companies value depth.

target.copy: Service companies use different tech stacks (Java, .NET) than product companies. Your transition will require learning new paradigms. Start with product company tech stacks or deepen in service domain.
target.goal: Master your target role, either by transitioning to product tech or becoming an expert in service domain.
action_items: Learn product company tech stacks (Python, Go, Node.js) OR deepen in Java/.NET
Practice system design at web scale
Understand product company culture and practices
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Stay in service companies but target better ones (higher pay, better tech, global teams). This is your natural home base where you can grow faster.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role at a better service company with modern tech and global presence.
action_items: Learn modern service company tech (cloud, microservices)
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Explore different specializations within service companies. If you're backend, try full-stack or DevOps. This broadens your skills.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become versatile within service company engineering.
action_items: Understand how it fits in service architecture
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_service_mid1.label: Service SWE - Mid (2-3 years)
swe_service_mid1.description: Mid-level service engineer. Your path: either transition to product companies or stay and grow in service.

target.copy: With 2-3 years in service companies, you can either transition to product (requires learning new stacks) or grow within service. Both paths are viable. Choose based on your interests.
target.goal: Achieve your target role, either by transitioning to product company or growing in service domain.
action_items: If transitioning: Learn product company tech stacks deeply
If staying in service: Deepen expertise in Java/.NET and enterprise patterns
System design practice at your target level
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies in tier-2 cities or smaller companies are easier to crack. Get experience there, then move to better service companies or product companies.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role at a tier-2 service company or smaller firm.
action_items: Negotiate for roles that will help you transition later
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Expand your skill set to adjacent roles. Full-stack, DevOps, or architectural roles are great for service engineers.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become versatile across multiple specializations in service domain.
action_items: Study how they integrate in enterprise systems
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_service_mid2.label: Service SWE - Mid (3-5 years)
swe_service_mid2.description: Senior mid-level. Time to decide: stay in service or transition to product? Both have good paths.

target.copy: At 3-5 years in service companies, you have strong fundamentals. Decide: Deep expertise in enterprise domain or transition to product company innovation? Both lead to senior/staff roles.
target.goal: Become senior engineer in your chosen path: enterprise excellence or product innovation.
action_items: If staying: Deepen enterprise architecture and leadership skills
If transitioning: Intensely learn product tech stacks and system design
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies value your 3-5 years of experience. Move to a top-tier service company for better pay and growth without the FAANG complexity.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get a senior role at a top service company.
action_items: Prepare for service company interview style
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: With 3-5 years of experience, you can pivot to architectural or leadership roles. Staff engineer or tech lead paths are available.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to architectural or leadership specialization.
action_items: Study technical leadership and system design deeply
Lead architectural decisions on your team
Build portfolio of major architectural projects
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_service_senior.label: Service SWE - Senior (5-8 years)
swe_service_senior.description: Senior service engineer. You're valuable at any company. Decide: Stay and grow to staff? Or move to product for different challenge?

target.copy: At 5-8 years in service companies, you have real power in the job market. You can transition to product companies at senior level, or become staff/principal in service. Choose your path.
target.goal: Land your ideal senior/staff role, either staying in service or transitioning to product.
action_items: If transitioning: Learn product company culture and tech stacks
If staying: Develop staff engineer skills and strategic thinking
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies will promote you quickly to staff/principal level. It's a strategic play: get the title, then move to FAANG or startups with more leverage.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get staff or principal role at service company, then leverage for FAANG move.
action_items: Network with hiring managers at top service companies
Emphasize your leadership and strategic impact
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: With 5-8 years of experience, you can move to specialized roles (Principal, Architect, Staff) or new specializations from a position of strength.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to specialized or leadership role with broader organizational impact.
action_items: Network with other architects and principals
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

swe_service_expert.label: Service SWE - Expert (8+ years)
swe_service_expert.description: You're at the top in service companies. You can go anywhere: FAANG, startup, CTO, or principal.

target.copy: With 8+ years in service companies, you understand enterprise-scale systems better than most FAANG engineers. Use this as your leverage. Target roles that value this expertise.
target.goal: Land your ideal role: principal engineer, CTO, or FAANG leadership position.
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Startups will offer you equity and founding engineer roles. Service company experience is invaluable for building scalable systems from scratch.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Join high-growth startup as founding or senior engineer with equity upside.
action_items: Network with startup founders and VCs
Discuss technical vision and equity terms
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Consider founding your own company, moving to CTO roles, or pursuing principal/architect paths. Your expertise is too valuable for just IC roles.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to founding, CTO, or principal/architecture role with broader impact.
action_items: Network with other founders and CTOs
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

devops_junior.label: DevOps Engineer - Junior (0-2 years)
devops_junior.description: You're in DevOps. Your path: Stay in DevOps and grow, or transition to SWE for broader opportunities.

target.copy: DevOps is specialized and valuable. Stay here and become a cloud/infrastructure expert, or transition to SWE for more options. Both are viable paths.
target.goal: Become expert in your target specialization (stay in DevOps or transition to SWE).
action_items: If staying in DevOps: Master Kubernetes, cloud platforms, infrastructure as code
If transitioning to SWE: Learn core SWE fundamentals and system design
Practice coding (Python, Go, or your preferred language)
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies value DevOps engineers more than product companies. It's an easier path in service companies with more stable projects.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role at a service company.
action_items: Prepare for service company interview style
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to SWE from DevOps. You have infrastructure skills—add SWE fundamentals and you'll be more versatile than pure SWEs.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to backend/full-stack engineering from DevOps foundation.
action_items: Learn core SWE fundamentals (data structures, algorithms)
Practice coding problems and system design
Build full application projects (not just infrastructure)
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

devops_mid1.label: DevOps Engineer - Mid (2-3 years)
devops_mid1.description: Mid-level DevOps. You're valuable. Stay and grow deep, or leverage for SWE transition.

target.copy: With 2-3 years in DevOps, you have cloud expertise. Double down as a platform engineer or transition to SWE with infrastructure knowledge.
target.goal: Become expert in your specialization: cloud/infrastructure or full-stack SWE.
action_items: If staying in DevOps: Deepen Kubernetes, terraform, cloud platform expertise
If transitioning: Add SWE fundamentals and system design
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies have more complex infrastructure. Move there for growth with less competition than product companies.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get senior DevOps or platform role at service company.
action_items: Prepare for service company infrastructure challenges
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to backend SWE. You already understand infrastructure—add core SWE skills and you're highly valuable.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become full-stack backend engineer with infrastructure expertise.
action_items: Practice system design at application level
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

devops_mid2.label: DevOps Engineer - Mid (3-5 years)
devops_mid2.description: Senior mid-level DevOps. Become principal/staff or transition to SWE with leverage.

target.copy: At 3-5 years in DevOps, you're a valuable specialist. Become a platform engineer/SRE/principal, or leverage your infrastructure expertise to transition to full-stack SWE at senior level.
target.goal: Become principal/staff engineer or senior full-stack engineer with infrastructure expertise.
action_items: If staying: Study platform engineering, SRE, and system reliability
If transitioning: Master full-stack development and system design
Network with other principals and architects
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: FAANG companies pay premium for experienced DevOps/SRE engineers. This is your advantage point.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get senior/staff SRE or platform engineer role at FAANG.
action_items: Emphasize your reliability and scale expertise
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to full-stack SWE from your DevOps foundation. You understand systems deeply—add application-level SWE and you're unstoppable.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become senior full-stack engineer with infrastructure and system design expertise.
action_items: Practice system design at FAANG level
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

devops_senior.label: DevOps Engineer - Senior (5-8 years)
devops_senior.description: Senior DevOps/SRE engineer. You're highly valuable. Principal roles or full-stack senior positions await.

target.copy: With 5-8 years in DevOps/SRE/Platform engineering, you're in high demand. FAANG companies actively recruit at your level. Go for principal/staff or senior full-stack roles.
target.goal: Land your ideal role: principal engineer, staff SRE, or senior full-stack at top company.
action_items: Perfect your system design and reliability thinking
Showcase your impact on scale and reliability
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies or startups will offer you CTO or principal engineer roles. Equity and impact are huge.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get CTO or principal engineer role at high-growth startup.
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Consider founding your company or moving to CTO roles. Your expertise is too valuable for just IC roles.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to CTO, founder, or architecture leadership.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

devops_expert.label: DevOps Engineer - Expert (8+ years)
devops_expert.description: You're at the top. Principal, CTO, or founding engineer roles.

target.copy: With 8+ years, you're in the top 1% of engineers. Your infrastructure and reliability expertise is invaluable. Target principal/staff roles or CTO positions.
target.goal: Land your ideal role: principal engineer, CTO, or founding engineer.
action_items: Clarify your vision: FAANG principal or startup CTO?
Showcase your impact on company reliability and scale
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Startups will offer you founding engineer or CTO roles with significant equity. This is your best financial upside.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Join high-growth startup as CTO or founding engineer.
action_items: Network with startup founders and VCs
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: You've mastered DevOps. Consider expanding into full-stack architecture, founding, or technical strategy roles.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to founder, CTO, or technical strategy role.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

qa_support_junior.label: QA/Support Engineer - Junior (0-2 years)
qa_support_junior.description: You're in QA/support. Your path: Stay and master QA automation, or transition to SWE for broader opportunities.

target.copy: QA is a great foundation. You can become a test automation expert, or transition to SWE with real testing knowledge. Both paths are valuable.
target.goal: Master your target specialization: QA automation or full-stack SWE.
action_items: If staying in QA: Master test automation frameworks and methodologies
If transitioning to SWE: Learn core SWE fundamentals and system design
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies have more complex testing needs. They'll hire QA engineers faster than product companies.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your target role at service company.
action_items: Target service companies with large QA teams
Emphasize your testing and quality focus
Prepare for service company testing strategies
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to backend SWE from QA foundation. You understand quality and testing—add SWE fundamentals and you'll write better code than most.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become full-stack engineer with strong testing and quality expertise.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

qa_support_mid1.label: QA/Support Engineer - Mid (2-3 years)
qa_support_mid1.description: Mid-level QA/support. Specialize or transition to SWE.

target.copy: With 2-3 years in QA, you can become a test automation expert, or leverage quality insights to transition to SWE. Both are viable.
target.goal: Become expert in your specialization: QA automation or full-stack SWE.
action_items: If staying: Master advanced test automation and frameworks
If transitioning: Learn SWE fundamentals and system design
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies need QA expertise more than product companies. Move there for faster growth.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get QA or automation role at service company.
action_items: Prepare for service company testing challenges
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to full-stack SWE. Your quality mindset will make you a better engineer than most developers.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become full-stack engineer with strong quality and testing expertise.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

qa_support_mid2.label: QA/Support Engineer - Mid (3-5 years)
qa_support_mid2.description: Senior mid-level QA. Become QA lead/architect or transition to SWE senior.

target.copy: With 3-5 years in QA, you can become a QA architect/lead, or transition to senior SWE with deep quality expertise.
target.goal: Become senior engineer: QA architect or full-stack SWE with quality focus.
action_items: If staying: Learn QA strategy and architecture
If transitioning: Master system design and full-stack development
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies will promote QA engineers quickly. Move there for senior/lead title and growth.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get senior QA or lead role at service company.
action_items: Target service companies with large QA teams
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to full-stack SWE senior. Your quality thinking makes you a better architect than pure SWEs.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become senior full-stack engineer with quality and architecture expertise.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

qa_support_senior.label: QA/Support Engineer - Senior (5-8 years)
qa_support_senior.description: Senior QA engineer. You're valuable. QA director/architect or senior SWE with quality expertise.

target.copy: With 5-8 years in QA, you're a recognized expert. Become a QA director/principal, or transition to senior SWE at a company that values quality.
target.goal: Land senior/principal role: QA architect or quality-focused full-stack engineer.
action_items: If staying: Develop QA strategy and leadership thinking
If transitioning: Perfect system design and technical leadership
Showcase your quality impact on company success
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies will fast-track you to QA director or principal level. Use this for negotiating with FAANG later.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get QA director or principal role at service company.
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to senior full-stack or staff engineer. Your quality expertise is rare and valuable for system design.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become senior/staff engineer with quality and architecture focus.
action_items: Network with architects and staff engineers
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

qa_support_expert.label: QA/Support Engineer - Expert (8+ years)
qa_support_expert.description: You're at the top. QA principal, engineering director, or CTO roles.

target.copy: With 8+ years in QA, you're a thought leader. Target QA director/principal, engineering director, or CTO roles. Your quality expertise is invaluable.
target.goal: Land your ideal executive or principal role: QA director, engineering director, or CTO.
action_items: Clarify your vision: Stay in QA leadership or broaden to CTO/VP Engineering?
Network at executive and investor levels
Showcase your impact on company reliability and success
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies will offer you director or CTO roles with significant responsibility. Startups will offer you equity and founding CTO positions.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Join high-growth startup or scale-up as CTO or VP Engineering.
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Transition to full-stack/architecture leadership or found your own company. Your expertise is too valuable for just IC roles.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Transition to founder, CTO, or VP Engineering role.
action_items: Network with other founders and VCs
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

_NON_TECH_PERSONAS.description: 5 personas (1 per target role): experience adjustments applied dynamically

nontech_frontend.label: Non-Tech → Frontend Engineer
nontech_frontend.description: You're transitioning to frontend. HTML/CSS/JS is your foundation. Easier specialization compared to backend.

target.copy: You're transitioning to frontend development. Good news: frontend is the most beginner-friendly path. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are intuitive. Focus on building projects and you'll be ready in 8-10 months.
target.goal: Land your first frontend engineer role at a tech company.
action_items: Master HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals
Learn a framework (React, Vue, or Angular)
Understand responsive design and UI/UX basics
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies or smaller startups are easier entry points. They're hiring frontend developers but with lower interview bars than FAANG.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your first frontend role at a service company or small startup.
action_items: Prepare for frontend interviews (not too hard)
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Explore full-stack instead. You'll learn frontend + backend and be more versatile.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become full-stack engineer, starting with frontend.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

nontech_fullstack.label: Non-Tech → Full-Stack Engineer
nontech_fullstack.description: You're transitioning to full-stack. More complex than frontend alone, but very marketable.

target.copy: Full-stack is your goal. You'll learn both frontend and backend, making you more valuable than specialists. It's harder, but the payoff is worth it. 10-12 months to your first role.
target.goal: Land your first full-stack engineer role.
action_items: Understand APIs and system design basics
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies or startups are easier for full-stack roles. You'll get hired faster and build real products.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your first full-stack role at service company or startup.
action_items: Master one tech stack (MERN or similar)
Focus on practical skills over theory
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Focus on backend instead. Backend is more fundamental and marketable for career growth.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Become backend engineer instead, then learn frontend later.
action_items: Learn databases, APIs, system design basics
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

nontech_backend.label: Non-Tech → Backend Engineer
nontech_backend.description: You're transitioning to backend. Harder than frontend, but more valuable long-term.

target.copy: Backend engineering is harder but more valuable. You'll master APIs, databases, and system design. It's the most in-demand specialization. 10-12 months of focused work gets you there.
target.goal: Land your first backend engineer role.
action_items: Master one backend language (Python or Node.js recommended)
Learn databases, APIs, and REST architecture
Practice coding problems and data structures
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Service companies need backend engineers more than product companies. It's an easier path to your first backend role.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get your first backend role at service company.
action_items: Master one backend language and framework
Learn relational databases and enterprise patterns
Focus on reliability and stability (service company values)
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Frontend might be faster. You'll learn HTML/CSS/JavaScript, build projects, and get hired quicker. Then move to full-stack or backend later.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Start with frontend, transition to backend for higher pay later.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

nontech_dataml.label: Non-Tech → Data/ML Engineer
nontech_dataml.description: You're transitioning to data/ML. Hardest path, but most cutting-edge and lucrative.

target.copy: Data/ML engineering is the hardest path but also the most cutting-edge. You need Python, statistics, ML algorithms, and data engineering skills. 12-15 months of consistent work gets you there.
target.goal: Land your first data/ML engineer role.
action_items: Master ML algorithms and libraries (scikit-learn, TensorFlow)
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: Data roles at service companies or data-focused startups are easier entry points. Less ML theory, more practical data engineering.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Get first data engineer role at service company.
action_items: Focus on data engineering over ML algorithms
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Backend engineering might be faster and more immediately hireable. You can specialize in data/ML later.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Start with backend, transition to data/ML for specialization.
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews

nontech_exploring.label: Non-Tech → Exploring (Test Intern Roles)
nontech_exploring.description: You're exploring. Try intern roles to figure out what you like before committing.

target.copy: Exploring is smart! Try these intern roles to figure out what you enjoy. Frontend and backend are fundamentally different. 3-6 months in intern roles helps you decide.
target.goal: Complete intern projects in frontend and backend to decide your path.
action_items: Understand the differences in day-to-day work
Talk to engineers in both fields
Decide based on what excites you
milestones: Month 1-2: Deep technical preparation - Master your specialization fundamentals
Month 3-4: Build portfolio projects - Create 1-2 substantial projects showcasing your target skills
Month 5+: Interview readiness - Polish profile, network, practice interviews, and apply to target roles

alternative_1_easier_company.copy: If you don't like frontend, try backend instead. Backend is more complex but more rewarding.
alternative_1_easier_company.goal: Try backend intern projects to see if that's your passion.
action_items: See if backend excites you more than frontend
milestones: Month 1-2: Foundation building - Strengthen core technical skills with focused practice
Month 3: Interview preparation - Prepare for company-specific interview patterns
Month 4+: Apply and negotiate - Submit applications and work through interview rounds

alternative_2_different_role.copy: Or try full-stack to experience both frontend and backend together.
alternative_2_different_role.goal: Try full-stack to see both sides together.
action_items: Decide if full-stack is for you
milestones: Month 1-2: Learn new specialization - Study fundamentals of the adjacent/alternative role
Month 3-4: Build cross-specialization projects - Create projects combining both skill sets
Month 5+: Deepen expertise - Gain depth in new specialization and prepare for interviews
